id.desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

itemGap.desc: The gap between each icon of toolbox. It is horizontal gap in horizontal layout, while vertical gap in vertical layout.

showTitle.desc: Whether to show the title of each tool icon when mouse hovers.

feature.desc:
The configuration item for each tool.

Besides the tools we provide, user-defined toolbox is also supported.

Notes: User-defined tool name could only start with my, like myTool1 and myTool2 in the below example:

{
    toolbox: {
        feature: {
            myTool1: {
                show: true,
                title: 'custom extension method 1',
                icon: 'path://M432.45,595.444c0,2.177-4.661,6.82-11.305,6.82c-6.475,0-11.306-4.567-11.306-6.82s4.852-6.812,11.306-6.812C427.841,588.632,432.452,593.191,432.45,595.444L432.45,595.444z M421.155,589.876c-3.009,0-5.448,2.495-5.448,5.572s2.439,5.572,5.448,5.572c3.01,0,5.449-2.495,5.449-5.572C426.604,592.371,424.165,589.876,421.155,589.876L421.155,589.876z M421.146,591.891c-1.916,0-3.47,1.589-3.47,3.549c0,1.959,1.554,3.548,3.47,3.548s3.469-1.589,3.469-3.548C424.614,593.479,423.062,591.891,421.146,591.891L421.146,591.891zM421.146,591.891',
                onclick: function (){
                    alert('myToolHandler1')
                }
            },
            myTool2: {
                show: true,
                title: 'custom extension method',

                onclick: function (){
                    alert('myToolHandler2')
                }
            }
        }
    }

feature.saveAsImage.type.desc:
File suffix of the image saved.

  • If the renderer is set to be 'canvas' when chart initialized (default), then 'png' (default) and 'jpeg' are supported.
  • If the renderer is set to be 'svg' when when chart initialized, then only 'svg' is supported for type ('svg' type is supported since v4.8.0).

feature.saveAsImage.name.desc: Name to save the image, whose default value is title.text.

feature.saveAsImage.backgroundColor.desc: Background color to save the image, whose default value is backgroundColor. If backgroundColor is not set, white color is used.

feature.saveAsImage.connectedBackgroundC.desc: When echarts.connect is used to connect the interaction of multiple chart series, they will all be included in the exported image. This option sets the background color between these charts.

feature.saveAsImage.excludeComponents.desc: Components to be excluded when export. By default, toolbox is excluded.

feature.saveAsImage.icon.desc:
It can be set to an image with 'image://url' , in which URL is the link to an image, or dataURI of an image.

An image URL example:

'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'

A dataURI example:

'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'

Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via 'path://' in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to SVG PathData for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.desc: The style setting of save as image icon. Since icon label is displayed only when hovering on the icon, the label configuration options are available under emphasis.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.color.desc:
color.

Color can be represented in RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)'. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.

// Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
color: {
    type: 'linear',
    x: 0,
    y: 0,
    x2: 0,
    y2: 1,
    colorStops: [{
        offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
    }, {
        offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
    }],
    global: false // false by default
}
// Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
color: {
    type: 'radial',
    x: 0.5,
    y: 0.5,
    r: 0.5,
    colorStops: [{
        offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
    }, {
        offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
    }],
    global: false // false by default
}
// Fill with texture
color: {
    image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
    repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
}

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderColo.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of color.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderWidt.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderType.desc: Border type, which can be 'solid', 'dashed', or 'dotted'. 'solid' by default.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY to set shadow to component.

For example:

{
    shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
    shadowBlur: 10
}

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.shadowColo.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as color.

Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

feature.dataView.optionToContent.desc:
(option:Object) => HTMLDomElement|string

Define a function to present dataView. It is used to replace default textarea for richer data editing. It can return a DOM object, or an HTML string.

For example:

optionToContent: function(opt) {
    var axisData = opt.xAxis[0].data;
    var series = opt.series;
    var table = '<table style="width:100%;text-align:center"><tbody><tr>'
                 + '<td>Time:</td>'
                 + '<td>' + series[0].name + '</td>'
                 + '<td>' + series[1].name + '</td>'
                 + '</tr>';
    for (var i = 0, l = axisData.length; i < l; i++) {
        table += '<tr>'
                 + '<td>' + axisData[i] + '</td>'
                 + '<td>' + series[0].data[i] + '</td>'
                 + '<td>' + series[1].data[i] + '</td>'
                 + '</tr>';
    }
    table += '</tbody></table>';
    return table;
}

feature.dataView.contentToOption.desc:
(container:HTMLDomElement, option:Object) => Object

When optionToContent is used, if you want to support refreshing chart after data changes, you need to implement the logic to merge options in this function.

feature.dataView.lang.desc: There are 3 names in data view, which are ['data view', 'turn off' and 'refresh'].

feature.dataView.backgroundColor.desc: Background color of the floating layer in data view.

feature.dataView.textareaColor.desc: Background color of input area of the floating layer in data view.

feature.dataView.textareaBorderColor.desc: Border color of input area of the floating layer in data view.

feature.dataZoom.desc: Data area zooming, which only supports rectangular coordinate by now.

feature.dataZoom.icon.zoom.desc:
It can be set to an image with 'image://url' , in which URL is the link to an image, or dataURI of an image.

An image URL example:

'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'

A dataURI example:

'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'

Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via 'path://' in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to SVG PathData for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.desc: The style setting of data area zooming icon. Since icon label is displayed only when hovering on the icon, the label configuration options are available under emphasis.

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.color.desc:
color.

Color can be represented in RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)'. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.

// Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
color: {
    type: 'linear',
    x: 0,
    y: 0,
    x2: 0,
    y2: 1,
    colorStops: [{
        offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
    }, {
        offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
    }],
    global: false // false by default
}
// Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
color: {
    type: 'radial',
    x: 0.5,
    y: 0.5,
    r: 0.5,
    colorStops: [{
        offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
    }, {
        offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
    }],
    global: false // false by default
}
// Fill with texture
color: {
    image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
    repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
}

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.borderColor.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of color.

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.borderWidth.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.borderType.desc: Border type, which can be 'solid', 'dashed', or 'dotted'. 'solid' by default.

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY to set shadow to component.

For example:

{
    shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
    shadowBlur: 10
}

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as color.

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

For example:

Shadow color. Support same format as color.
Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

feature.dataZoom.emphasis.iconStyle.opac.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

feature.dataZoom.emphasis.iconStyle.text.desc: Fill color of text. If it's not set, it will use in the order of icon's fill color, stroke color, and '#000'.

feature.dataZoom.xAxisIndex.desc: Defines which xAxis should be controlled. By default, it controls all x axes. If it is set to be false, then no x axis is controlled. If it is set to be then it controls axis with axisIndex of 3. If it is set to be [0, 3], it controls the x-axes with axisIndex of 0 and 3.

feature.dataZoom.yAxisIndex.desc: Defines which yAxis should be controlled. By default, it controls all y axes. If it is set to be false, then no y axis is controlled. If it is set to be then it controls axis with axisIndex of 3. If it is set to be [0, 3], it controls the x-axes with axisIndex of 0 and 3.

feature.magicType.desc:
Magic type switching. 示例: 

feature: {
    magicType: {
        type: ['line', 'bar', 'stack', 'tiled']
    }
}

feature.magicType.type.desc: Enabled magic types, including 'line' (for line charts), 'bar' (for bar charts), 'stack' (for stacked charts), and 'tiled' (for tiled charts).

feature.magicType.title.desc: Title for different types, can be configured seperately.

feature.magicType.icon.desc: the different types of icon path , which could be configurated individually.

feature.brush.desc:
Brush-selecting icon.

It can also be configured at brush.toolbox.

feature.brush.type.desc:
Icons used, whose values are:

  • 'rect': Enabling selecting with rectangle area.
  • 'polygon': Enabling selecting with any shape.
  • 'lineX': Enabling horizontal selecting.
  • 'lineY': Enabling vertical selecting.
  • 'keep': Switching between single selecting and multiple selecting. The latter one can select multiple areas, while the former one cancels previous selection.
  • 'clear': Clearing all selection.

feature.brush.icon.rect.desc:
It can be set to an image with 'image://url' , in which URL is the link to an image, or dataURI of an image.

An image URL example:

'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'

A dataURI example:

'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'

iconStyle.desc: The style setting of Shared icon. Since icon label is displayed only when hovering on the icon, the label configuration options are available under emphasis.

iconStyle.color.desc:
color.

Color can be represented in RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)'. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.

// Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
color: {
    type: 'linear',
    x: 0,
    y: 0,
    x2: 0,
    y2: 1,
    colorStops: [{
        offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
    }, {
        offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
    }],
    global: false // false by default
}
// Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
color: {
    type: 'radial',
    x: 0.5,
    y: 0.5,
    r: 0.5,
    colorStops: [{
        offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
    }, {
        offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
    }],
    global: false // false by default
}
// Fill with texture
color: {
    image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
    repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
}

iconStyle.borderColor.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of color.

iconStyle.borderWidth.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

iconStyle.borderType.desc: Border type, which can be 'solid', 'dashed', or 'dotted'. 'solid' by default.

iconStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with shadowColor,shadowOffsetX, shadowOffsetY to set shadow to component.

For example:

{
    shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
    shadowBlur: 10
}

iconStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as color.

iconStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

iconStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

iconStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

emphasis.iconStyle.color.desc:
color.

Color can be represented in RGB, for example 'rgb(128, 128, 128)'. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example 'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example '#ccc'. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.

// Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
color: {
    type: 'linear',

// Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.

}

emphasis.iconStyle.borderColor.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of color.

emphasis.iconStyle.borderWidth.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

emphasis.iconStyle.borderType.desc: Border type, which can be 'solid', 'dashed', or 'dotted'. 'solid' by default.

{

emphasis.iconStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

emphasis.iconStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

emphasis.iconStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

emphasis.iconStyle.textFill.desc: Fill color of text. If it's not set, it will use in the order of icon's fill color, stroke color, and '#000'.

zlevel.desc:
zlevel value of all graphical elements in .

zlevel is used to make layers with Canvas. Graphical elements with different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvases, which is a common optimization technique. We can put those frequently changed elements (like those with animations) to a separate zlevel. Notice that too many Canvases will increase memory cost, and should be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid crash.

Canvases with bigger zlevel will be placed on Canvases with smaller zlevel.

z.desc:
z value of all graphical elements in , which controls order of drawing graphical components. Components with smaller z values may be overwritten by those with larger z values.

z has a lower priority to zlevel, and will not create new Canvas.

left.desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the left side of the container.

left value can be instant pixel value like 20; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like '20%'; and it can also be 'left', 'center', or 'right'.

If the left value is set to be 'left', 'center', or 'right', then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

top.desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the top side of the container.

top value can be instant pixel value like 20; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like '20%'; and it can also be 'top', 'middle', or 'bottom'.

If the left value is set to be 'top', 'middle', or 'bottom', then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

right.desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the right side of the container.

right value can be instant pixel value like 20; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like '20%'.

Adaptive by default.

bottom.desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the bottom side of the container.

bottom value can be instant pixel value like 20; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like '20%'.

Adaptive by default.

width.desc: Width of toolbox component. Adaptive by default.

height.desc: Height of toolbox component. Adaptive by default.

tooltip.desc:
Tooltip configuration for toolbox tooltip, which is similar to tooltip. It is not shown by default. If you wish to set special style for toolbox icon label (especially when using CSS to control text style), you may set as the following example:

option = {
    tooltip: {
        show: true // include tooltip component for the feature
    },
    toolbox: {
        show: true,
        showTitle: false, // hide the default text so they don't overlap each other
        feature: {
            saveAsImage: {
                show: true,
                title: 'Save As Image'
            },
            dataView: {
                show: true,
                title: 'Data View'
            },
        },
        tooltip: { // same as option.tooltip
            show: true,
            formatter: function (param) {
                return return '<div>' + param.title + '</div>'; // user-defined DOM structure
            },
            backgroundColor: '#222',
            textStyle: {
                fontSize: 12,
            },
            extraCssText: 'box-shadow: 0 0 3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);' // user-defined CSS styles
        }
    },
    ...
}
